A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
Rian Johnson dropped the ball on this one. Big time. 

1) He completely destroyed the mystery and intrigue of Rey\, and made her and her backstory (the main character of the new trilogy) of no significance. 

2) He took the other two new main characters (Finn and Po) and put them in a storyline that nobody cares for that made up the majority of the film. He also introduced a new\, boring and pointless character in Rose for which clearly looks to be for no other reason than for audience appeal and expanding the character diversity roster. 

3) He under utilised Luke Skywalker. One of the strongest Jedi of all time who in previous stories\, not only had his own Jedi Academy but ensured it continued to exist and produced new Jedi Masters. 

When he did finally make Luke do something cool and show off his power and skill\, he once again made it all for nothing and showed that this isn't the case at all (watch the film to see what really happened). 

Basically the whole thing was a massive lost opportunity to make something truly epic. All the fan theories and speculation was far more exciting than what we actually got.

And let's not even mention that particular scene with Princess Leia...
